description: From flattery to concessions, every detail was arranged to minimize the risk of a diplomatic incident at the NATO summit in The Hague. It is time to change tactics, argues Le Monde columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

description: Most Iranians who live in the United Arab Emirates oppose the government in Tehran; they feel torn between rejecting Israel's aggression and feeling satisfaction at seeing regime figures eliminated.

headline: New museum will honor Art Nouveau genius Hector Guimard in Paris
description: The museum devoted to the architect who designed the Paris metro entrances will be housed in the HÃ´tel Mezzara, one of his masterpieces. It is expected to open at the end of 2027 or the beginning of 2028.

headline: Paris men's fashion week: Saint Laurent and Louis Vuitton unveil vibrant, colorful shows
description: For the men's spring-summer 2026 collections, presented in Paris through June 29, Anthony Vaccarello blended powerful silhouettes and bold hues for Saint Laurent, while Pharrell Williams drew on motifs of elephants, giraffes and zebras inspired by India for Louis Vuitton.

headline: French MPs investigating TikTok: 'Young people are being sacrificed'
description: A parliamentary committee investigating TikTok's psychological effects on minors, launched in March under rapporteur Laure Miller and chair Arthur Delaporte, who spoke to Le Monde, wrapped up its hearings on June 24.

description: A blockade of the strait, through which one-fifth of global oil consumption passes, would have a catastrophic impact on the world economy. Iran, which depends on its oil revenues, has much to lose, as does China, its main customer.

headline: The challenges of a 'Pax Hebraica' in the Middle East
description: The bombing of Iran's main nuclear sites by the US marks the triumph of Israel, which in just a few months has become the sheriff of the Middle East, writes Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.

headline: The three lives of NATO, born from a gamble, now deemed obsolete by Trump
description: Created out of America's desire to protect Europe from communism, the North Atlantic Alliance underwent profound changes after the fall of the Berlin Wall. It expanded and took on new missions, though it never fully proved its effectiveness. Today, it faces fierce challenges from Donald Trump.
